parameters.content:
# Rule Name: allow access from forge
# Description: Open up postgresql for access
# Order: 150
host	private_forge	forge	0.0.0.0/0	md5

# Rule Name: allow access to all users
# Description: none
# Order: 100
host	all	all	127.0.0.1/32	md5

# Rule Name: allow access to ipv6 localhost
# Description: none
# Order: 101
host	all	all	::1/128	md5

title: pg_hba_rule_allow localhost TCP access to postgresql user

parameters.content:
# Rule Name: allow localhost TCP access to postgresql user
# Description: none
# Order: 003
host	all	postgres	127.0.0.1/32	md5

# Rule Name: deny access to postgresql user
# Description: none
# Order: 004
host	all	postgres	0.0.0.0/0	reject

# Rule Name: local access as postgres user
# Description: none
# Order: 001
local	all	postgres		ident

title: pg_hba_rule_local access to database with same name

parameters.content:
# Rule Name: local access to database with same name
# Description: none
# Order: 002
local	all	all		ident

before: Postgresql_psql[UPDATE pg_database SET datistemplate = false WHERE datname = 'private_forge']
notify: Postgresql_psql[REVOKE CONNECT ON DATABASE "private_forge" FROM public]

require: Postgresql_psql[CREATE ROLE "forge" ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'md58fa212bf1002a5c794033a5202a048e2' LOGIN NOCREATEROLE NOCREATEDB NOSUPERUSER  CONNECTION LIMIT -1]
parameters.unless: SELECT rolname FROM pg_roles WHERE rolname='forge' and rolconnlimit=-1

require: Postgresql_psql[CREATE ROLE "forge" ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'md58fa212bf1002a5c794033a5202a048e2' LOGIN NOCREATEROLE NOCREATEDB NOSUPERUSER  CONNECTION LIMIT -1]
